Mike Clark wrote:

>If I only write new code when a test is failing, I should never have an
>untested path in new code.
>
I'm afraid you forgot refactoring.
When simplifying your code, you can make it work though fewer paths, 
while not removing the no-longer needed ones.
Their uselessness would not jump to your face, as all the tests would pass.

Alain Ravet
